alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued March 29 at 12:34PM EDT until March 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM WEDNESDAY TO 7 PM CDT THURSDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected with 2 to 3 feet above normally dry ground in the Mobile Bay region and 1 to 2 feet above normally dry ground in the Western Florida panhandle. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Alabama, Mobile Coastal and Baldwin Coastal Counties. In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, from 10 AM Wednesday to 7 PM CDT Thursday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 3 PM Wednesday to 7 AM CDT Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 7 PM CDT this evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life- threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
